title: Composition of Functions: Part B
body:
These problems are generally harder, often highlighting an important subtlety. If we wanted to justify the claim that the composition of two odd functions is another odd function, i.e. if f and g are odd functions, then f $$\circ$$ g is an odd function, we could show the following steps:

(f $$\circ$$ $$g)(-x)=f(g(-x))=f(-g(x))=-f(g(x))=-(f$$ $$\circ$$ g(x))

Give justification for each step. The first step is done for you.

(f $$\circ$$ $$g)(-x)=f(g(-x))$$ is true by the definition of function composition.
